quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All right Jim. Your quarterlies look very good. How are things at the library?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, I told you. I couldn't close it. So...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: So you've come to the master for guidance? Is this what you're saying, grasshopper?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Actually, you called me in here, but yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All right. Well, let me show you how it's done.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [on the phone] Yes, I'd like to speak to your office manager, please. Yes, hello. This is Michael Scott. I am the Regional Manager of Dunder Mifflin Paper Products. Just wanted to talk to you manager-a-manger. [quick cut scene] All right. Done deal. Thank you very much, sir. You're a gentleman and a scholar. Oh, I'm sorry. OK. I'm sorry. My mistake. [hangs up] That was a woman I was talking to, so... She had a very low voice. Probably a smoker, so... [Clears throat] So that's the way it's done.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I've, uh, I've been at Dunder Mifflin for 12 years, the last four as Regional Manager. If you want to come through here... See we have the entire floor. So this is my kingdom, as far as the eye can see. This is our receptionist, Pam. Pam! Pam-Pam! Pam Beesly. Pam has been with us for...  forever. Right, Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Well. I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: If you think she's cute now, you should have seen her a couple of years ago. [growls]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Any messages?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Uh, yeah. Just a fax.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh! Pam, this is from Corporate. How many times have I told you? There's a special filing cabinet for things from corporate.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You haven't told me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's called the wastepaper basket! Look at that! Look at that face.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: People say I am the best boss. They go, "God we've never worked in a place like this before. You're hilarious." "And you get the best out of us." [shows the camera his WORLD'S BEST BOSS mug] I think that pretty much sums it up. I found it at Spencer Gifts.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [singing] Shall I play for you? Pa rum pump um pum [Imitates heavy drumming] I have no gifts for you. Pa rum pump um pum [Imitates heavy drumming]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: My job is to speak to clients on the phone about... uh, quantities and type of copier paper. You know, whether we can supply it to them. Whether they can pay for it. And... I'm boring myself just talking about this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Whassup!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Whassup! I still love that after seven years.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Whassup!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Whassup!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Whass...up!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Whassup.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [Strains, grunts] What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Nothing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK. All right. See you later.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: All right. Take care.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Back to work.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: [on her cell phone] Just before lunch. That would be great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Corporate really doesn't really interfere with me at all. Jan Levinson Gould. [walking out of his office] Jan, hello.  I call her Hillary Rodham Clinton. Right? Not to her face, because... well, not because I'm scared of her. Because I'm not. But, um... Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Alright, was there anything you wanted to add to the agenda?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Um... Me no get an agenda.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: What? I'm sorry?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I didn't get any agenda.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Well, I faxed one over to you this morning.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Really? I didn't... [looks at Pam] Did we get a fax this morning?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Uh, yeah, the one...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Why isn't it in my hand? A company runs on efficiency of communication, right? So what's the problem, Pam? Why didn't I get it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You put in the garbage can that was a special filing cabinet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, that was a joke. That was a joke that was actually my brother's, and... It was supposed to be with bills and it doesn't work great with faxes.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Do you want to look at mine?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, yeah. Lovely. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: OK. Since the last meeting, Ellen and the board have decided we can't justify a Scranton branch and a Stamford branch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Michael, don't panic.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no, no, no, this is good. This is good. This is fine. Excellent.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: No, no, no, Michael, listen OK. Don't panic. We haven't made... We haven't decided.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All the alarm bells are kind of going... ringie-dingie-ding!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: I've spoken to Josh in Stamford. I've told him the same as you and it's up to either him or you to convince me that your branch can incorporate the other.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK. No problem.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: This does, however, mean that there is going to be downsizing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Me no wanna hear that, Jan. Because downsizing is a bitch. It is a real bitch. And I wouldn't wish that on Josh's men. I certainly wouldn't wish it on my men. Or women, present company excluded. Sorry. Uh, is Josh concerned about downsizing himself? Not downsizing himself but is he concerned about downsizing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Question. How long do we have to... [Telephone rings] Oh uh, Todd Packer, terrific rep. Do you mind if I take it?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Michel
quotes.line: Packman.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: Hey, you big queen.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, that's not appropriate.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: Hey, is old Godzillary coming in today?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Uh, I don't know what you mean.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: I've been meaning to ask her one question. Does the carpet match the drapes?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, my God! Oh! That's... horrifying. Horrible. Horrible person.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: So do you think we could keep a lid on this for now? I don't want to worry people unnecessarily.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, absolutely. Under this regime, it will not leave this office. [zips his lips] Like that.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: So what does downsizing actually mean?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Well...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You guys better update your resumes just like I'm doing.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I bet it's gonna be me. Probably gonna be me.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah, it'll be you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I have an important question for you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yes?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Are you going to Angela's cat party on Sunday?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah, stop. That is ridiculous.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Am I going to tell them? No, I am not going to tell them. I don't see the point of that. As a doctor, you would not tell a patient if they had cancer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: This is Mr. Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Guilty! Guilty as charged!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Ryan Howard from the temp agency. Daniqua sent me down to start today.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Howard, like Moe Howard. Three Stooges.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Watch this. This is Moe. Nyuck-nyuck-nyuck-nyuck-nyuck. Mee! [hold hand up for a high five] Ah, right here. Three Stooges. Oh, Pam. It's a guy thing, Pam. I'm sort of a student of comedy. Watch this. Here we go. [Yelling in cod German] I'm Hitler. Adolf Hitler. [Continues with cod German]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I don't think it would be the worst thing if they let me go because then I might... I don't think it's many little girls' dream to be a receptionist. I like to do illustrations. Um... Mostly watercolor. A few oil pencil. Um, Jim thinks they're good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Dunder Mifflin. This is Pam.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Sure. Mr. Davis, let me call you right back. Yeah, something just came up. Two minutes. Thank you very much. Dwight, what are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Just clearing my desk. I can't concentrate.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: It's not on your desk.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It's overlapping. It's all spilling over the edge. One word, two syllables. Demarcation.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You can't do that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Why not?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Safety violation. I could fall and pierce an organ.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [crosses fingers] We'll see. [Dwight begins smashing pencils with his phone] This is why the whole downsizing thing just doesn't bother me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Downsizing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Downsizing? I have no problem with that. I have been recommending downsizing since I first got here. I even brought it up in my interview. I say, bring it on.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You just still have these messages from yesterday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Relax. Everything's under control. Uh, yeah. Yeah. That's important. Right. Oh this is so important, I should run to answer it. [Imitating Six-Million Dollar Man sound effect]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Come on. Six-Million Dollar Man! Steve Austin! Actually, that would be a good salary for me, don't you think? Six million dollars? Memo to Jan. I deserve a raise.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Don't we all?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm sorry?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Nothing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: If you're unhappy with your compensation, maybe you should take it up with HR. OK. Not today, OK? Pam, just be professional. [Sighs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I think I'm a role model here. I think I garner people's respect. [Imitating a PA] Attention all Dunder Mifflin employees, please. We have a meeting in the conference room, ASAP.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: People I respect, heroes of mine, would be Bob Hope... Abraham Lincoln, definitely. Bono. And probably God would be the fourth one. And I just think all those people really helped the world in so many ways that it's really beyond words. It's really incalculable.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Now I know there's some rumors out there and I just kind of want to set the record straight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I'm Assistant Regional Manager. I should know first.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Assistant to the Regional Manager.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: OK, um, can you just tell me please? Just tell me quietly. Can you whisper it in my ear?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm about to tell everybody. I'm just about to tell everybody.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Can't you just tell us.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Please, OK? Do you want me to tell 'em?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You don't know what it is. [Laughs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: OK. You tell 'em. With my permission. Permission granted.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't need your permission.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Corporate has deemed it appropriate to enforce an ultimatum upon me. And Jan is thinking about downsizing either the Stamford branch or this branch.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I heard they might be closing this branch down. That's just the rumor going around. This is my first day. I don't really know.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Yeah but Michael, what if they downsize here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Not gonna happen.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: It could be out of your hands Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It won't be out of my hands Stanley, OK. I promise you that.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Can you promise that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: On his mother's grave.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, yeah, it is a promise. And frankly, I'm a little insulted that you have to keep asking about it.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: It's just that we need to know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I know. Hold on a second. I think Pam wanted to say something. Pam, you had a look that you wanted to ask a question just then.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I was in the meeting with Jan and she did say that it could be this branch that gets the axe.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.line: Are you sure about that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, Pam maybe you should stick to the ongoing confidentiality agreement of meetings.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Pam, information is power.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: You can't say for sure whether it'll be us or them, can you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, Stanley. No, you did not see me in there with her. I said if Corporate wants to come in here and interfere, then they're gonna have to go through me. Right? You can go mess with Josh's people, but I'm the head of this family, and you ain't gonna be messing with my chillin.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: If I left, what would I do with all this useless information in my head? You know? Tonnage price of manila folders? Um, Pam's favorite flavor of yogurt, which is mixed berry.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Jim said mixed berries? Well, yeah, he's on to me. Um... [Laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Watch out for this guy. Dwight Schrute in the building. This is Ryan, the new temp.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: What's up? Nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Introduce yourself. Be polite.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Dwight Schrute, Assistant Regional Manager.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Assistant to the Regional Manager. So, uh, Dwight tell him about the kung fu and the car and everything.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Uh... yeah I got a '78 280Z. Bought it for $1,200. Fixed it up. It's now worth three grand.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's his profit.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: New engine, new suspension, I got a respray. I've got some photos.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Damn it! Jim!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK. Hold on, hold on. The judge is in session. What is the problem here?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: He put my stuff in Jell-O again.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [Laughing]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That's real professional thanks. That's the third time and it wasn't funny the first two times either Jim.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It's OK here, but people sometimes take advantage because it's so relaxed. I'm a volunteer Sheriff's Deputy on the weekends. And you cannot screw around there. That's sort of one of the rules.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What is that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That is my stapler.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no, no. Do not take it out. You have to eat it out of there, because there are starving people in the world [turns to camera] which I hate, and it is a waste of that kind of food.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: OK you know what, you can be a witness. [points to Ryan] Can you reprimand him?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: How do you know it was me?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It's always you. Are you going to discipline him or not?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Discipline. Kinky! [Laughs] All right, here's the deal you guys. The thing about a practical joke is you have to know when to start and as well as when to stop.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And yeah, Jim this is the time to stop putting Dwight's personal effects into Jell-O.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: OK. Dwight, I'm sorry, because I have always been your biggest flan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [Laughing] Nice. That's the way it is around here. It just kind of goes round and round.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: You should've put him in custardy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey! Yes! New guy! He scores.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: OK, that's great. I guess what I'm most concerned with is damage to company property. That's all.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Pudding. Pudding... I'm trying to think of another dessert to do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Do you like going out at the end of the week for a drink?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That's why we're all going out. So we can have an end-of-the-week-drink.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: So when are we going out?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Tonight, hopefully.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: OK. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: Hey, man.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What's going on?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: Hey, baby.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Roy's my fiance. We've been engaged about three years. We were supposed to get married in September but I think we're gonna get married in the spring.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Do you mind if I go out for a drink with these guys?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: No, no. Come on. Let's get out of here and go home.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: OK. I'm gonna be a few minutes. So it's only twenty past five. I still have to do my faxes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You know what? You should come with us. Because you know we're all going out and it could be a good chance for you to see what people are like outside the office. I think it could be fun.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: It sounds good. Seriously, we've gotta get going.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Um... What's in the bag?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: Just tell her I'll talk to her later.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, definitely. All right, dude. Awesome. Will do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Do I think I'll be invited to the wedding? [scratches head]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: So have you felt the vibe yet? We work hard, we play hard. Sometimes we play hard when we should be working hard. Right? I guess the atmosphere that I've created here is that I'm a friend first, and a boss second... and probably an entertainer third. [Knock at door] Just a second. Right? Oh, hey do you like The Jamie Kennedy Experiment? Punk'd and all that kind of stuff?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You are gonna be my accomplice. Just go along with it, OK?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Just follow my lead. Don't pimp me, all right? Come in. So, uh, Corporate just said that I don't want to...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You got a fax.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, thank you. Pam, can you come in here for a sec. Just have a seat. I was gonna call you in anyway. You know Ryan. As you know, there is going to be downsizing. And you have made my life so much easier in that I am going to have to let you go first.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What? Why?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Why? Well, theft and stealing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Stealing? What am I supposed to have stolen?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Post-it Notes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Post-it Notes? What are those worth, 50 cents?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: 50 cents, yeah. If you steal a thousand Post-It Notes at 50 cents apiece, and you know,  you've made a profit... margin. You're gonna run us out of business, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Are you serious?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah. I am.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I can't believe this. I mean I have never even stolen as much as a paperclip and you're firing me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: But the best thing about it is that we're not going to have to give you any severance pay. Because that is gross misconduct and... Just clean out your desk. I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [Pam starts crying] You been X'd punk! [Laughing] Surprise! It's a joke. We were joking around. See? OK. He was in on it. He was my accomplice. And it was kind of a morale booster thing. And we were showing the new guy around, giving him the feel of the place. So you... God, we totally got you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You're a jerk.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't know about that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What is the most important thing for a company? Is it the cash flow? Is it the inventory? Nuh-uh. It's the people. The people. My proudest moment here was not when I increased profits by 17% or when I cut expenses without losing a single employee. No, no, no, no, no. It was a young Guatemalan guy. First job in the country, barely spoke English. He came to me, and said, "Mr. Scott, would you be the godfather of my child?" Wow. Wow. Didn't work out in the end. We had to let him go. He sucked.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: How are things?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Good. I thought you were going out for a drink with...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh no, I just decided not to. How's your headache?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: It's better, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Good. Good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That's great

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Um... Are you...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Am I walking out?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yes, I... Do you want to...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Great. Let me just...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [Car horn honking] Oh, Roy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah. Listen, have a nice weekend.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah, definitely. You too. Enjoy it. [looks at camera] You know what, just come here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Dwight Schrute. My father's name, also Dwight Schrute. My grandfather's name, Dweide Schrude, Amish. That's my family. I don't know where they came, the Amish, came from originally. Uh, Amland.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [holding up a Dundie and pretending it is talking] Hello. I'm Michael Scott. I'm the best boss in the world.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: My name is Jim Halpert and I am a sales rep, which is a very important job. Um, without me dozens literally dozens of small businesses would go paperless.  They would have to write on their hands, or bed sheets, or who knows you know. Total chaos, total chaos. I mean or they could get their paper somewhere else. Staples maybe. I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Pam! Pam-Pam! Pam has been with us for...  forever. Right, Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I guess.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, at one time or another every guy in the office has sprayed on Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Messages?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: People respond to the human touch and that's what I give them. I can look at a client and I can say, "Hello, how are you? How's business been going?" And we can go back and forth for sometime and uh, then I'll say, How much, how many reams do you want?" And they'll order it and then I'll take care of all the sales. I'll make sure that they get that paper. And they appreciate that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ah, right here. Three Stooges. High five. [Michael and Ryan high five] Oh, Pam. It's a guy thing, Pam. [camera cuts to Pam then back to Michael] Now, who was the one before Curly?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Uh, Shemp.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Curly? Very good. Curly Joe DeRita.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Just Curly. Joe DeRita was different.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, comedy's kinda my thing. Watch this, here's Curly Joe. Mmm. Me, me, me, me, me, me. Me, me, me, me, me, me. Oh, I forgot. Here we go. [Yelling in cod German] I'm Hitler. Right. [Continues with cod German] Me, me, me, me, me, me. Curly Joe Hitler. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All these people are walking around and they're happy and their lives are just going along, ignorance is bliss. But if they knew what was lurking on the other side of that fence that furry monster. [imitating monster] "I'm gonna get you, downsizing." No. They wouldn't... They'd freak. And I'm not going to play God. They look to me for support. And they look to me for guidance and leadership. And I think if I could lie to them and it serves them, then that's what I'm going to do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: So this is our sales staff. They are the ones who are making calls and making us lots of money. [comes to a screeching halt and laughs] This is accounting. The numbers dudes. Do not let the job description fool you, they are all completely crazy. Especially that guy, he is a mental patient. [camera zooms in on Kevin] Not literally of course, that wouldn't work. The last place you'd want somebody like that is accounting. [hides behind office plant] "Very interesting, but stupid." Artie Johnson. It's a crazy place.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: My name is Angela and um, I'm in charge of the accounting department. There are three of us, Kevin and Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: It's my job to keep the books in order. And, um, I... I'm, uh, immediately below my supervisor.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Oscar, how do I describe him. He's like a stapler. Do I need a stapler? Yes. But, I'm still the one that has to push it down.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: There's a lot of anxiety. I don't want to get laid off. This place is like five minutes from my house.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I don't wanna be laid off. This is a good job for me. 'Cause I need my nights free. I'm in a band.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Not very worried about downsizing right now. Because, uh, I think you've met Kevin and um...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Can I just say one thing? Um, my friend is Jewish, Art Geller. And a couple of years ago he, um, showed me how you can plant a tree in Israel, so I planted a tree. So... You know 'cause... Yeah we work in paper. Well, you know, I try to give back.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I have a lot of cat figurines on my desk. I think cats, really, are old souls. And, uh, Phyllis thinks so too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What you don't know... Well, it can hurt you, but if you don't know it won't hurt you. Then, you can just be happy for a little while at least.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What's that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Wired.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, John Belushi. What a crazy guy. Phew, freaked myself out this morning.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah. I thought I found a lump. I checked the, uh... I check the jewels every month. This time... You know, it's a little different. It was fine. It was fine. But freaky, man, you know. Testicular cancer, God. Cancer, whoa testicles. So... What's, um... What you eating?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Smoked turkey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, place around the corner. Nice. All right. See you later.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Do I need to speak up? [grabs boom microphone] Hello.

quotes.speaker: Documentary Crew Member
quotes.line: [boom microphone drops into the camera shoot] Can you move it out? Can you move it? Is that all right? Can you make that work?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That's fine.

quotes.speaker: Documentary Crew Member
quotes.line: [new take] No, you don't even need ... That's fine. We'll keep it...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I'm sorry it makes me nervous.

quotes.speaker: Documentary Crew Member
quotes.line: Understood, but it is what we need to capture what you're saying as clearly as possible.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I understand. It's in a blind spot because I'm trained in several martial arts and one of them, uh, includes, uh, an awareness that the masters bring, uh, of anything on all sides of you. It could be behind you or whatever. This is directly in a blind spot, so I'm trained to respond negatively to something right above my head. [new take] This now I have an eye on. You see, it's on my periphery and if I needed to block it, attack it, stop it somehow. [does a martial arts move with his hands] I could come right out. I mean, I know you're doing your job, but... Documentary Crew Member: [talking over Dwight] It's...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I'm doing my job.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I think better to be a happy idiot then a, um... Then someone who knows the truth.
